body:
incorporation of /ping /ms to know your ms in game

please put this plugin
body_tagged:
incorporation of /ping /ms to know your ms in game

please put this plugin
title: incorporartion

replies.body: Hover above the green 5 bars that are beside the server's player count to see what's your ms/ping.
replies.body_tagged: Hover above the green 5 bars that are beside the server's player count to see what's your ms/ping.

replies.body: He wants to know it in-game
replies.body_tagged: He wants to know it in-game

replies.body: yeah, I guess that would be nice to have.
replies.body_tagged: yeah, I guess that would be nice to have.

reply_to.body: He wants to know it in-game
reply_to.body_tagged: He wants to know it in-game

replies.body: yeah cause i have a lot of internet issues so i think it might me a good a idea to just type /ping /ms to know about your connection
replies.body_tagged: yeah cause i have a lot of internet issues so i think it might me a good a idea to just type /ping /ms to know about your connection

replies.body: +1 Please add this. The ping indicator built into minecraft isn't accurate. If you're on windows you can just go to cmd (command prompt) and type in 'ping avic.us' it will send about five small packets to the server and will tell you the minimum, average and highest ping (just take note of the average.)
replies.body_tagged: +1 Please add this. The ping indicator built into minecraft isn't accurate. If you're on windows you can just go to cmd (command prompt) and type in 'ping avic.us' it will send about five small packets to the server and will tell you the minimum, average and highest ping (just take note of the average.)

If you're on windows you can just go to cmd (command prompt) and type in 'ping avic.us' it will send about five small packets to the server and will tell you the minimum, average and highest ping (just take note of the average.)

replies.body:
The same for when you're playing.

You should use cmd.exe to measure your ping when your internet is:

1. stable
2. not used to download big things
3. not used to stream videos

and when you're computer isn't overloaded.

Simply right click the windows logo, open the command prompt (cmd.exe) and type in: ping avic.us


Time=xxxms is your ping

replies.body: Would be cool to have this but i feel we have more important things to focus on before we start getting cool little plugins like this.
